content: need to slip_stitch to close do not turn 34 body + 9 head r6 skip the slip_stitch from previous round that joined the side of the head to the body single_crochet into next 3 stitches c8 single_crochet in the second loop from the hook then single_crochet in each chain back to the single_crochet base 7 single_crochet total along this chain and each of the chains on this round to make the first leg single_crochet in the next 3 stitches then repeat the c8 single_crochet back down the chain repeat the 3 single_crochet c8 sc7 a total of 4 times on this side of the spider lay the applique on a flat surface and use stitch markers to mirror the placement of the legs on the opposite side the markers should be placed in the 4th 7th 10th and 13th stitches from the join of the head to body single_crochet in each stitch around the bottom of the spider to the first marker then single_crochet c8 single_crochet down the chain as before single_crochet into the next 2 stitches and repeat the leg pattern until you have completed 4 legs on this side of the spider single_crochet into the last 3 stitches on the body then single_crochet x 2 scinc twice along the head single_crochet x 2 and slip_stitch to close the round fo you may want to leave ~ 1m of yarn tail to sew the spider to the blanket weave in the other ends making sure to secure the magic_ring 34 plus 8 x 7sc legs plus 10 for head pattern for side webbing fold one side of the blanket into equal 3rds place a stitch marker at the center of each fold repeat on each side at the centre front of the blanket place a stitch marker at 1/3rd and 2/3rd of the way between the corners on each side between rounds 2 and 3 using a piece of yarn at least 20 51cm long create a straight line between each stitch marker at the centre and the corresponding stitch marker at the edge of the blanket place stitch markers along this line at each of the colour c rounds remove the piece of yarn using colour c make a slip knot and slip_stitch the yarn at the first stitch marker at the center of the blanket chain between 6 and 10 chains to span the distance between each stitch marker without causing the blanket to pucker slip_stitch into the marked round then continue to chain and slip_stitch up to and around each row that is marked until you reach to blanket edge fo repeat to make a total of 8 thin webs 2 on each side weave the ends either into the chain or into the rounds of webbing pattern for corner webbing similar to the side webbing using colour c make a slip knot and slip_stitch the yarn at the top of r2 on the centre front of the blanket make a chain long enough to reach
